Purpose and approach Purpose 1.1 The purpose of this Policy is to clarify the process which Brighton & Hove City Council (the “Council”) will follow when considering the accommodation and care and support needs of residents within the community. This includes when the Council is responsible for funding care and accommodation in residential or nursing home care and complies with the Care Act 2014. The Council will listen and take account of the service user's preferences as to how those needs are met

Introduction and legal basis for charging for care and support 1.1 This policy is approved by Brighton and Hove City Council and is compliant with The Care Act 2014, Care Act Regulations and Guidance. The aim is to provide a consistent and fair framework for assessing and charging all service users following an assessment of individual needs, and individual financial circumstances. The policy applies to all service users equitably. Section 14 of The Care Act 2014 provides councils with a power to charge for meeting a person’s eligible needs in a single legal framework. Section 17 of The Care Act requires local authorities to undertake an assessment of financial resources. This will determine the amount a person should pay towards the cost of providing for their needs for care and support whether provided to people living in their own home or in a care home. To prepare for a financial assessment for care in Brighton & Hove, you should gather documents related to your income, capital, and assets. Your contribution towards care costs is calculated based on these financial resources, taking into account any mandatory disregards as defined by the Care and Support Statutory Guidance.

**Documents to Prepare:**
- Proof of income (e.g., payslips, pension statements)
- Details of savings and investments
- Information on any property owned
- Documentation of any gifts or transfers of assets

**Contribution Calculation:**
- The assessment considers your income, capital, and assets.
- A **Personal Expenditure Allowance (PEA)** of **£30.15 per week** is allowed.
- Additional allowances, such as a Savings Credit Disregard, may apply based on eligibility.

**Practical Next Steps:**
- For more detailed guidance, refer to the Care Act 2014 Guidance at [gov.uk](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/care-act-statutory-guidance/care-and-support-statutory-guidance).
- Contact Brighton & Hove City Council's Adult Social Care services for assistance with the assessment process.

According to the documents, the financial assessment process is designed to be fair and consistent, ensuring that your contribution is based on your individual financial circumstances.
